And so it ends.  A doomed experiment really.  How can an international community of photographers and thinkers prevail in a time of riots and debts.  The American Century is over.  Europe is in ruins.  Everyone looks East with fear.  And now, without a common platform, they look alone and isolated.  The best that they can achieve is random messages tossed into the ether but without a timely reply it may as well be a whisper into a storm.  At best it is a message in a bottle - we see that there are others on their islands but we cannot commune.

So last saturday I went in to nyc with a buddy to shoot some shit, and we walk up on the brooklyn bridge...
and this crazy lady asks me to take her pic
she's got a small boom box playing prince
she asks if I can take her pic and email it to her, I'm happy to oblige
I take a second one as she's going through her purse looking for paper and a pen
eventually she tears off a scrap of paper and proceeds to give me not only her email but phone number, address and the number of her aunt Ethel (I swear not a word of this is made up)
but it gets better...
I take the paper and later on while having lunch show it to the guy I went with
